Q301. What is the tenure of the President/Office bearer (in complete years) Q302. Has there been any rotation of the roles of the member (in last one year) Q303. Has there been any election for the office bearer Q304. In what frequency the election for office bearer happens?(in complete years) Q305. Does your Sangha have a common (group) bank account Q305a. what are the challenges in opening bank account Q306. How much does each member contribute to group savings Q306a. Q309a. From where the members avail the loan? Q309b. Please specify others Q310. What are the challenges in availing loan (minimum 1 and maximum upto 3 responses possible) Q401. Are meetings conducted in your Sangha/group/collective? Q402. What is the frequency of meetings? Q402a. Please specify others Q403. Regularity of members attending meeting Q404. Does the meetings happen as per the schedule (check meeting register) Q405. Does your Sangha/group/ collective have a record book? (check for the record book) Q406. Is the record book /register updated in every meeting? Q501. Has the Sangha/group/collective established any linkage with (options below) Q501a. Please specify the others Q501b. What service/services you are getting through this linkage(more than one response upto three is possible). Q502. Is your sangha /collective currently availing any services/ schemes Q502a. Please provide details of the service/scheme that you are availing (more than one response upto three is possible) Q502b. From which department/service provider you are availing this scheme/service? Q601. Is your Sangha / collective members interested in taking up any collective enterprise/business Q602a. Please specify others Q602. Please Enter Please Select Total number of members in the group/collective must be equal to sum of Total number of male members,female members and transgender members in the group/collective Age of the member must be between 18-65 year valid mobile number Total number of adult members in family must be equal to the sum of number of adult male members and adult female members Q109. Household Unique ID Total number of adolescent boys and girls must be equal to sum of number of adolescent boys and adolescent girls Total number of children must be equal to sum of number of male children and female children Total number of earning members must be equal to sum of number of male earning member and female earning member Tenure of the President/Office bearer must be between 1-5 year Q308a. Please specify others Q309. Are the members able to easily avail loan? District Please Select Household Id The sum of adult male and female members must be equal to or less than the total adult members. Adult male members must be equal to or less than the total adult members. Adult female members must be equal to or less than the total adult members. The sum of adolescent boys and girls must be equal to or less than the total adolescents. Adolescent boys must be equal to or less than the total adolescents. Adolescent girls must be equal to or less than the total adolescents. The sum of male and female children must be equal to or less than the total number of children. Male children must be equal to or less than the total number of children members. Female children must be equal to or less than the total number of children members. The sum of male and female earning members must be equal to or less than the total number of earning members. Male earning members must be equal to or less than the total number of earning members. Female earning members must be equal to or less than the total number of earning members.

HHID IMID Name of the participant Age of the participant Primary occupation if any Secondary occupation if any Name of the Community SHG Name(if applicable) Nature of enterprise (Existing / Planned) if any Contact Number Name of the CRP Date 1.1. The minimum age of the applicant must be 18 years and the maximum age limit is set to 45 years. 1.2. Applicant education 1.3. Preference to women from socially backward category (SC / ST / OBC) 1.4. Preference to women from economic backward category (APL / BPL / Antyodaya) 2.1. Self-employment / business experience 2.2. Years of experience in Self-employment / business 2.3. Stage of Self-employment / enterprise idea 2.4. Size / Investment of self-employment / business planned 2.5. Willingness to invest margin money in business 2.6. Awareness on relevant markets and supply chain actors for the proposed self-employment / business 3.1. If you are asked to invest INR 50,000 in a new business idea from your savings, how will you evaluate the risk? 3.2. If you are given three options of Income Generation Activity depending upon time to be invested per day, which one will you prefer? 3.3. If you are given three options of Income Generation Activity depending upon staff required to be managed which one, will you prefer? 3.4. Women cannot become good entrepreneurs as they are burdened with domestic work in their households” How much do you agree with this statement? 3.5. “An entrepreneur requires only financial resources to become an entrepreneur.” How much do you agree with this statement? 3.6. Willingness to invest time for capacity building trainings to be organized by CARE India for potential entrepreneurs? 3.6. Which are the areas where you feel you need capacity building support to become a successful entrepreneur? 3.6a. Please specify others
